Parsing Utilities¶

Functions in this file are used to process csv to networkx graph instance and networkx graph instance to csv

lntk.parser.csv_to_networkx(node_csv, edge_csv, node_id=0, edge_id1=0, edge_id2=1, header=True, verbose=False)[source]¶

Everything is casted as a string.

Parameters:
  • node_csv –
  • edge_csv –
  • node_id –
  • edge_id1 –
  • edge_id2 –
  • header –
  • verbose –
Returns:
lntk.parser.networkx_to_csv(G, node_csv_path, edge_csv_path, header=True)[source]¶

Generate two csv from a networkx graph. The first one represents a list of nodes while the second represents a list of edges.

Parameters:
  • G – a networkx graph
  • node_csv_path – the path to the node csv output location
  • edge_csv_path – the path to the edge csv output location
  • header – If True, the generated csv will have a header.
lntk.parser.parse_edges_csv(edge_csv_path, edge_id_column1=0, edge_id_column2=1, header=True)[source]¶
lntk.parser.parse_nodes_csv(node_csv_path, node_id_column=0, header=True)[source]¶

If no header is present, only the ids will be retrieve. If a header is present, every columns except the id columns will be
